intro: Mostacillastrum purpusii, commonly known as the purple threeawn, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces distinctive spikelets with bristly awns, which are often used for wind dispersal of its seeds. Its foliage is usually narrow and grass-like, with a bluish-green hue. Mostacillastrum purpusii is adapted to withstand drought and is often found in disturbed soils and sandy habitats.
